goto.doc: move to a new timezone, but at this same moment. Accepts an IANA code or abbreviation

clone.doc: make a copy of this object, with no references to the original

timezone.doc: return a bunch of meta-data about your current timezone

startOf.doc: move to the first millisecond of the day, week, month, year, etc.

endOf.doc: move to the last millisecond of the day, week, month, year, etc.

add.doc: increment the time by a number and unit - like an hour, minute, day, or year

subtract.doc: decrease the time by a number and unit - like an hour, minute, day, or year

next.doc: go to the beginning of the next unit

last.doc: go to the beginning of the previous unit

nearest.doc: move forward/backward to the closest unit

every.doc: list all dates up to a certain time

isAfter.doc: pass-in a spacetime object or date input and see if it takes-place after your spacetime date/time

isBefore.doc: pass-in a spacetime object or date input and see if it takes-place before your spacetime date/time

isEqual.doc: is this date on the exact same millisecond as another

isSame.doc: detect if two date/times are the same day, week, or year, etc

diff.doc: given a date amd a unit, count how many of them you'd need to make the dates equal

millisecond.doc: set or return the current number of milliseconds (0-999)

second.doc: set or return the current number of seconds (0-59)

minute.doc: set or return the current number of minutes (0-59)

hour.doc: set or return the current hour, in 24 time (0-23). also accepts/parses '3pm'

date.doc: set or return the day-number of the month (1- max31)

month.doc: set or return the zero-based month-number (0-11). Also accepts 'June', or 'oct'.

year.doc: set or return the 4-digit year as an integer

dayOfYear.doc: set or return the day of the year (1-366). Jan 1st is 1, Dec 31st is 366.

time.doc: set or return a formatted, 12-hour time, like '11:30pm'

week.doc: set or return the week-number of the year (1-52).

season.doc: set or return the name of the season, spring/summer/fall/autumn/winter

hourFloat.doc: set or return the hour + minute in decimal form, so '3:30am' is 3.5

day.doc: set or return the day of the week as an integer, starting on sunday (day-0). Also accepts names like 'wednesday', or 'thurs'

ampm.doc: set or return whether the time is am or pm

dayTime.doc: set or return the general time-of-day, like 'afternoon'

monthName.doc: set or return the current month as a string, like 'april'

isValid.doc: does this time exist on the gregorian/javascript calendar?

log.doc: pretty-print the date to the console, for nicer debugging

progress.doc: Between 0-1, how far the moment lands between the start and end of the day/week/month/year.

leapYear.doc: is the current year a leap year?

inDST.doc: is daylight-savings-time activated right now, for this timezone?

hasDST.doc: does this timezone ever use daylight-savings

offset.doc: the current, DST-aware time-difference from UTC, in hours

isAsleep.doc: checks if the current time is between 10pm and 8am

i18n.doc: changes the names of months and days

weekStart.doc: change the starting of the week (default is monday)

daysInMonth.doc: returns the amount of days the current month has (December => 31, June => 30, ...)
